org.factcenter.qilin.primitives

Interface TrapdoorNonInteractiveCommitment

  • All Superinterfaces:
    NonInteractiveCommitment

    public interface TrapdoorNonInteractiveCommitment
extends NonInteractiveCommitment
    Represents a non-interactive commitment scheme with a trapdoor. A trapdoor non-interactive commitment scheme is a non-interactive commitment scheme where one of the parties (either the verifier or the committer) may know a trapdoor: a secret key that allows a committer to equivocate or a verifier to learn the committed value. These two cases are represented by the sub-interfaces TrapdoorNonInteractiveCommitment.EquivocatingCommitter and TrapdoorNonInteractiveCommitment.RevealingVerifier.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  TrapdoorNonInteractiveCommitment.EquivocatingCommitter<C,E,R>
      Represents a commitment-scheme committer with a trapdoor that breaks the commitment's binding property.
      static interface  TrapdoorNonInteractiveCommitment.RevealingVerifier<C,E,R>
      Represents a commitment-scheme verifier with a trapdoor that breaks the commitment's hiding property.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.factcenter.qilin.primitives.NonInteractiveCommitment

        NonInteractiveCommitment.Committer<C,E,R>, NonInteractiveCommitment.Verifier<C,E,R>
